Class ThreadPool

java.lang.Object
java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
ThreadPool
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, Executor, ExecutorService
public class ThreadPool extends ThreadPoolExecutor
The threadPool class extends ThreadPoolExecutor to provide custom thread pool functionality.

This thread pool provides detailed logging of task lifecycle events including: task start, completion and pool termination. It maintains a fixed-size pool with an unbounded task queue.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ThreadPool

      public ThreadPool(int corePoolSize, int maximumPoolSize)
      Constructs a new ThreadPool with fixed size configuration.

      Creates a thread pool where both core and maximum pool sizes are equal. Uses an unbounded queue and 1-minute keep-alive time for thread termination policy.

      Parameters:
      corePoolSize - the number of threads to keep in the pool
      maximumPoolSize - the maximum number of threads in the pool

  • Method Details

    • beforeExecute

      protected void beforeExecute(Thread thread, Runnable runnable)
      Logs task execution start.

      Called immediately before executing the given task in the specified thread.

      Overrides:
      beforeExecute in class ThreadPoolExecutor
      Parameters:
      thread - the thread that will run the task
      runnable - the task that will be executed

    • afterExecute

      protected void afterExecute(Runnable runnable, Throwable throwable)
      Logs task completion.

      Called after the given task has completed execution.

      Overrides:
      afterExecute in class ThreadPoolExecutor
      Parameters:
      runnable - the task that was executed
      throwable - any exception that occurred, or null if none

    • terminated

      protected void terminated()
      Logs thread pool termination

      Called when the executor has terminated all threads and is being shut down.

      Overrides:
      terminated in class ThreadPoolExecutor
